list.name: alias-game-api
list.label: fullstack
list.shortDescription: Real-time team-based multiplayer word guessing game (Taboo-style).
list.longDescription:
Players authenticate, create or join rooms, are divided into teams, and take turns describing and guessing words. There is a React frontend that communicates with the backend via HTTP (Axios) and real-time synchronization using WebSockets (Socket.IO).
The application is designed to run locally inside a Docker container. There is no production deployment yet.

list.name: delivery-api
list.label: backend
list.shortDescription: API for a fast food ordering application.
list.longDescription:
REST API designed for fast food platforms and/or restaurant use. It allows customers to place orders from the restaurant menu, calculates total price and delivery time, and manages order states throughout the entire process.
The application is designed to run locally inside a Docker container. There is no production deployment yet.

list.name: electronics
list.label: electronics
list.longDescription:
Throughout my studies, I explored the field of electronics by working on projects ranging from basic to more advanced, including:
- AC/DC converter using capacitors and diodes.
- Analog pulse oximeter: measuring finger pulse using phototransistors, analog filters, and operational amplifiers.
- State machines: implemented using logic gates for different practical assignments, with a digital alarm being the most notable.
- ADC/DAC conversion and storage: converting an analog signal using an ADC module, storing it in RAM, and converting it back using an R-2R DAC.
- PIC microcontroller programming in Assembly: projects using displays and keypads, with the most notable being a swimming pool pump controller.
